benchmark_details.name: SecLLMHolmes
benchmark_details.overview: SecLLMHolmes is a comprehensive framework designed to evaluate the performance of large language models (LLMs) in identifying and reasoning about software vulnerabilities across eight investigative dimensions using a set of 228 code scenarios.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the efficiency and reasoning capabilities of chat-based LLMs for vulnerability detection.

data.source: Constructed from hand-crafted code scenarios, real-world Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVEs), and augmented code scenarios.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on comparison of LLM answers against ground truth labels.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in detecting security vulnerabilities and providing correct reasoning.
